page.title: 11A farmworker's day in Creca
page.content: My wife and I have lived in Creca since we married over 28 years ago. We have two daughters who are now married. A typical day starts at 7am when I rise, have breakfast and read the paper. A short walk takes me to the farm to start at 8pm. As the farm comprises mainly of beef-cattle and sheep the first task is to check and feed the animals which can take anything up to two hours. After a tea-break I bruise oats for feeding the next day. I then clear out the cattle sheds, and, as it is Autumn, the sheep dipper. Once lunch is over I return to the farm and fix the hedge cutter to the tractor in readiness for cutting. This done, I go to the field and fence off a fresh strip of turnips for the sheep to feed on. Around 4pm I prepare the milk to feed the calves. This done it is time to return home.
